title: Siegfried Schoenbohm
text:
Siegfried Schoenbohm (born 1938 in <a href="South%20Dakota">South Dakota</a>, USA - died spring 2006) was an <a href="opera">opera</a> <a href="stage%20director">stage director</a>. He was assistant of <a href="Walter%20Felsenstein">Walter Felsenstein</a>. 
He worked at: 
<a href="Komische%20Oper%20Berlin">Komische Oper Berlin</a> (1966ff),
 Opera (1973–1978),
 Stadttheater (1981–1983),
and Opera (1983–1991).
He was guest director (premieres) at Staatsoper , , here staging <a href="Richard%20Wagner">Richard Wagner</a>'s "<a href="Der%20Ring%20des%20Nibelungen">Der Ring des Nibelungen</a>", "<a href="Die%20Walk%C3%BCre">Die Walküre</a>" 1998, "<a href="Siegfried%20%28opera%29">Siegfried</a>" 1999, <a href="Dortmund">Dortmund</a>, <a href="Hanover">Hanover</a>, <a href="Frankfurt">Frankfurt</a>, <a href="Athens">Athens</a>.
He also was the first stage-director of <a href="Tiriel%20%28opera%29">Tiriel</a>.
He was the <a href="librettist">librettist</a> of Argyrēs Kounadēs Die bakchen (<a href="Euripides">Euripides</a> (1996).
